FuncDef:
The multicast-nat outbound-group command is used to create multicast-nat outbound-group, and enter the multicast-nat outbound-group view.
The undo multicast-nat outbound-group command is used to delete multicast-nat outbound-group.
By default, no multicast NAT outbound group is created in the system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a multicast NAT outbound group.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the ID of a multicast NAT outbound group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4000 .

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In multicast NAT, to translate an input multicast stream into output multicast streams, create a multicast NAT instance and then associate the input multicast stream with the multicast NAT instance. If the multicast input is a multicast NAT instance group, the multicast output must be a multicast NAT outbound group. To create a multicast NAT outbound group, run the multicast-nat outbound group command.
Prerequisites
Multicast NAT has been globally enabled using the multicast-nat enable command.
Precautions
This command is supported only in the admin VS.
